1stInt1: ^We arrive back home, weary and tired. I’ve never done anything quite like that before.
^Janet: We have to go to the police.
^Hunter: Are you crazy? They’ll arrest us for breaking into that place.
^Janet Not if we’re blowing the whistle on them. What kind of abandoned warehouse needs that kind of security?
^Hunter: One that we shouldn’t get involved in anymore.
^Player: Before we do anything, we should look at what we recovered.
^Hunter: Oh yeah, what did we grab?
^Player: This looks like… a memo? To employees of “the Echelon Institute.” I don’t know what that means.

^Janet: There’s not a whole lot… but they’re a political organization. Think policy and such. They say they’re not affiliated with any particular group, but they’re pretty aligned with… reactionary elements.
^Janet: Lithium? What do you- No, not like that. As in, people who don’t like change. And they get really extreme about it.
^Player: And my mom’s been taken by these people?
^Player: I think we need to go back there.
^Player: The police will take too long. Who knows what could happen to my mom in that time?
^Hunter: Wait, Janet, you’re supposed to be the reasonable one! You’re supposed to say no to stuff like this.
^Janet: [Player] makes a convincing point- the authorities will be slower to act than us.
^Hunter: Well, if you two are going to do this anyway, I guess I’m still in, too.
^Janet: Good. [Player], we’ll reconvene at the warehouse tomorrow afternoon.
^With that, my friends take their leave.
WarehouseExt2: ^I drift into a fitful sleep, the events of the past day replaying themselves in my head.
^This strange and secretive organization, what are their motives? How is my mom wrapped up in all this?
^Whatever the case, when I awaken in the morning, I barely feel rested, and in the afternoon I make my way over to the warehouse.
^Hunter: Wait, what if I’m not ready?
^Janet: Hunter, you’ve been here for 10 minutes with me. If you weren’t ready, you would have said so.
^Janet: So, [Player], shall we head on in?
